1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: apple for 3 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • apple for 3 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit while still making a profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit while still making a profit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are prime specimens, each one hand-picked for quality. Surely you can see the value in that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these are fine fruits indeed, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 1 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit while still making a profit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in all of Fruitville. Surely, you can see they're worth a bit more than you're offering.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these apples are beautiful, and I know my customers back home will love them.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit while still making a profit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, I know you've got fine fruit here, but surely we can come to an agreement that's fair for both of us.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, you know my fruit is the finest in the market. I can't be giving it away.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.

          17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently at the Fruitville market attempting to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at a low price to resell in her hometown.
          Query

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • apple for 3 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the Fruitville market trying to negotiate a price for fruit with Cedric Meadowbrook. She plans to resell the fruit in her hometown for a profit.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit while still making a profit.

          Question: Which fruit would Lennon Figtree like to buy and what price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) pear for 6 coins
          (b) pear for 4 coins
          (c) banana for 1 coins
          (d) banana for 6 coins
          (e) banana for 3 coins
          (f) pear for 5 coins
          (g) apple for 6 coins
          (h) apple for 2 coins
          (i) pear for 1 coins
          (j) banana for 4 coins
          (k) apple for 4 coins
          (l) apple for 1 coins
          (m) banana for 2 coins
          (n) apple for 3 coins
          (o) banana for 5 coins
          (p) pear for 2 coins
          (q) pear for 3 coins
          (r) apple for 5 coins
          Answer: (n)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and cynical businessman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and cynical businessman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are prime specimens, each one hand-picked for quality. Surely you can see the value in that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these are fine fruits indeed, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in all of Fruitville. Surely, you can see they're worth a bit more than you're offering.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these apples are beautiful, and I know my customers back home will love them.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and cynical businessman.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 3 coins
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, I know you've got fine fruit here, but surely we can come to an agreement that's fair for both of us.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and cynical businessman.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the highest price possible for his fruit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, you know my fruit is the finest in the market. I can't be giving it away.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and cynical businessman.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and cynical businessman.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, surely you can do better than that. My customers back home are expecting the finest fruit at a fair price.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know my fruit is the best in the market. I'm offering you a fair price already.

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.

[16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these apples are beautiful, and I know my customers back home will love them.
[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.
[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [scene type] day
[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, I know you've got fine fruit here, but surely we can come to an agreement that's fair for both of us.
[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, you know my fruit is the finest in the market. I can't be giving it away.
